bgu.dcr.az.api.exen

Interface Mailer


  • public interface Mailer
    This is a familiar concept, an Interface for designing mailers – the mailer is attached to the Execution object – what means that you should be able to attach different mailers to test the algorithm with (some mailers can help with producing algorithm visualization and some can be used for debugging).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void broadcast(Message msg)
      broadcast the given message to all mail groups
      void broadcast(Message msg, java.lang.String groupKey)
      broadcast a message to all agents (except the sending agent)
      void hookIn(Hooks.BeforeMessageSentHook hook)
      hook that will get called whenever the mailer will get new message
      boolean isAllMailBoxesAreEmpty(java.lang.String groupKey) 
      MessageQueue register(Agent agent, java.lang.String groupKey)
      register new Agent the mailbox can only send messages to registered agents
      void releaseAllBlockingAgents()
      release all blocking agents from all mail groups this method only make sense if you are trying to terminate the whole execution as it may harm the integrity of its results
      void releaseAllBlockingAgents(java.lang.String mailGroup)
      release all blocking agents from a specific mail group
      void send(Message msg, int to, java.lang.String groupKey)
      send a message to a registered agent
      void setExecution(Execution aThis)
      set the execution that this mailer is responsible for
      void unregister(int id, java.lang.String groupKey)
      remove agent with the given id from the registered list,
      void unregisterAll()
      remove all registered agents usecase: reset mailer
